proposed_strategy.name: Split by Major Section Boundary
proposed_strategy.description: The document is split into two chunks at a Khaṇḍa boundary (after Khaṇḍa 8) to adhere to the 20,000 character limit while preserving complete logical sections.

execution_plan.description: Prapathaka 8, Khaṇḍa 9 through Khaṇḍa 15, including final closing remarks.

parsing_instructions.justification: The document structure pairs original verses (Mantra) with extensive commentary (Bhashya, marked by प्र.) which must be kept together as the primary semantic unit for analysis.

start_pattern.description: The unit begins with the original Sanskrit verse text, which terminates with a verse number marker (double danda surrounding digits).

end_pattern.description: The unit terminates immediately before the start of the next numbered verse, or a formal section closing marker (e.g., end of Khaṇḍa or Bhāṣya).

parsing_instructions.pre_content_handling: Treat all text preceding the first numbered verse (।। १ ।।) as prefatory and descriptive metadata (e.g., Prapathaka heading, Vidyā name).
